result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
03:02 PM Defendant Ler Ba Nu in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Charlie Hoffmann, supervised by Andrew Nesheim, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Interpreter Cynas Hla appeared by zoom and was sworn in by the court.
This case is dismissed and read in to 21CF1563.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

08:42 AM Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Ler Ba Nu did not appear from custody.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court waived Defendant's appearance due to last-minute cancellation of interpreter. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:04 AM Defendant Ler Ba Nu in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sandaw Aye appeared by Zoom as interpreter and sworn in. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The State and Defense conducts a colloquy with the Interpreter as he is not a certified.
Mr. Aye states his qualifications as a Karen Interpreter.
The parties and Court states that they can proceed with the hearing.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Brandon Danowski, of the City Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Will.
Cross examination by attorney Kershek.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
The State presents rebutal arugments.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on January 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:42 AM Claudia Ayala appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ler Ba Nu in court, in custody.    
Sandaw Aye appeared as interpreter by zoom video.

The Court reviews the history of this case on the record and notes the Public Defenders Office filed an order appointing counsel today that Attorney Mark Kershek will represent the defendant.  
This Court is aware that Attorney Kershek is unavailable to appear in Court at this time due to being ill.
The Court places findings on the record and finds good cause to briefly adjourn the preliminary hearing.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The defendant requests to address bail.
The Court will not address bail today but will make note of this so Attorney Kershek is aware the defendant will be requesting a modification of bail.  
Bail remains as fixed.
KAREN INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR NEXT DATE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Attorney Mark Kershek has been appointed to represent the defendant.

02:22 PM Defendant Ler Ba Nu not in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court waived the defendants appearance today due to not having an interpreter available.  This matter is set for a status of counsel date and there is currently a preliminary hearing set for tomorrow.  Court was notified that Attorney Mark Kershek is going to be appointed as counsel but is unable to appear.  The Court will convert tomorrow's date to a status hearing and notes an interpreter will be available tomorrow.  Hearing scheduled for January 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ler Ba Nu
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-04-2022)
Prior: 5250 N 68Th St, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is to comply with all of the bail conditions in Waukesha County Case No. 21CF1563.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

03:10 PM Defendant Ler Ba Nu in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cynas Hla appeared by Zoom as interpreter.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
